newsitem.title: USA: Hollinger Intl Q3 below its expectations.
newsitem.headline: Hollinger Intl Q3 below its expectations.

text.p: Hollinger International Inc, which reported third-quarter earnings of $0.04 per share, up from $0.02 a year ago, said results were somewhat below the company's expectations.

It cited the performance of its international newspaper group, with improved circulation revenues of $1.5 million as a result of a cover price increase in November 1995 and gains in advertising revenues of $5.9 million partly offset by increased newsprint and promotional costs.
Hollinger's stock was trading at 11-1/4, off 1/4.

Although worldwide newsprint prices are coming down, European price changes often lag behind U.S. price changes. Hollinger said its London-based Daily Telegraph enters into medium-term supply contracts with vendors, resulting in delays in changes in newsprint costs.
At the same time, the Telegraph is delivering editions with increased pages to a higher circulation base.

The company's U.S. Newspaper Group posted revenues of $149.5 million, up 10 percent over the same 1995 quarter, though its Chicago Group operating revenues of $81.8 million were level with the prior year.

Operating income for the U.S. Newspaper Group rose by $9.7 million in the quarter, to which acquisitions contributed $4.7 million. The International Newspaper Group's quarterly operating income decreased by $1.7 million.
Hollinger International publishes newspapers in the United States, United Kingdom, Australia, Canada and Israel.
